answers.answer: Based on your presentation, it appears the symptoms you are experiencing are related to the injuries you sustained 2 months ago.  It is unlikely that MS or Bell's palsy is involved in your symptoms.  Has an MRI or CT scan been done before?Consult a neurologist as soon as possible so that your condition can be properly evaluated.

I have not had a MRI or CT. When I asked my GP if what I was experiencing was because of the blow to the head, he told me he highly doubted it. It could be a slow intracranial bleed (sub acute subdural) but I got hit two months ago. A more probable cause could be Encephalitis, but I am not a doctor. I am going to see my GP tomorrow to tell him the pins and needles have gotten worse and to try and pressure the neurologist into seeing me earlier.
So it seems that for public health care it takes 11 weeks to see a neurologist. I am going to see one privately tomorrow evening. Details to come about what he may think it is.

So I talked to my neurologist on Monday. All my nervous systems tests came back fine. He thinks it is Post Traumatic Syndrome caused by the hit to the head. I had an MRI of my cervical spine and brain yesterday and get the results tomorrow. He thinks they will come back normal. I noticed a lump on the right side of my neck today. My guess is that the MRI is going to show I have a lump on my thyroid, and my symptoms have actually been thyroid related caused by this lump. Details to come tomorrow.

question: About 2 months ago I accidently got kicked in the side of the head after a night at the bar. My right ear and side of my head was swollen for about a week. Shortly after this I started getting a little dizzy off/on for a couple weeks. I figured it was a head cold. During this time I had a sore throat. A couple weeks ago my left arm went numb for a couple hours and I went to the emergency room. They told me it was a pinched nerve in my shoulder. A couple days after that I started getting pins and needles in my hands and feet. About a day after I got floaters in my right eye, and ringing in my right ear. The feeling has gone from my hands and feet to everywhere in my body off and on. I have experienced dizzyness, headaches, and a slight case of vertigo the last few weeks. I am a 24 year old male with no family history of MS. My blood tests have come back normal from my GP, no diabetes, and I have an appointment with a neurologist very soon. I was wondering what people here might think it is. It is sort of playing games with my mind because my older brother recently had a case of Bells Palsy. Any ideas? Thanks in advance.
title: Neuro Symptoms
